intro: Coppensia paranapiacabensis, commonly known as the Paranapiacá orchid, is a rare and endemic flowering plant found in the Brazilian state of Paraná. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with a unique coloration. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and specialized roots adapted for nutrient absorption in nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
